posts.post_content: This card seems to expensive and much too risky for any practical use. While it will put a damper on what your opponents play, it hurts you in that same fashion, as you don't want to put yourself in harms way with your own spells. And besides, if you get far enough in to play this, you're gonna want to drop your bombs to win, not to have them mirrored back on you. The only use I could possibly see for this would be in a creature based blue deck with little in the line of spells, and that notion just makes me laugh at the ridiculousness of it.
posts.html:
This card seems to expensive and much too risky for any practical use. While it will put a damper on what your opponents play, it hurts you in that same fashion, as you don't want to put yourself in harms way with your own spells. And besides, if you get far enough in to play this, you're gonna want to drop your bombs to win, not to have them mirrored back on you. The only use I could possibly see for this would be in a creature based blue deck with little in the line of spells, and that notion just makes me laugh at the ridiculousness of it.
Report Abuse

posts.post_content:
This card would do excellent in combo with certain other cards, and make it so that it only benefits you.  
  
[Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir)  
[Eye of the storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eye of the storm)  
[Reiterate/Mirari](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reiterate/Mirari)  
[Djinn illuminatus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Djinn illuminatus)  
  
Along with cards that have things like replicate and storm. (maybe flashback)  
  
This way, you get everyone's spells, you get to replicate them, and the only time anyone else can benefit from any of these is during their main phases. Then, you can most likely whip out something to prevent that too.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: I found a great way to utilize this card for instant win. It's quite simple, really. Right after playing the spell, simply play one of the many pacts, and the opponent will copy it, EVERYTHING, so on that upkeep, if the pact is in a color that that particular player's color's isn't he can't pay the cost and will lose. Does that work?

posts.post_content:
use this correctly and its insanely powerful and i do mean stupidly powerful. if you just want a fun time put it in a red/blue blasty deck start a big multiplayer and watch the fun fly nothing quite like 8 people doing shock spells.  
  
but if you want to use it for power put in mana cost X cards, the copies always count as having zero mana paid as X meaning whilst you get a nice fireball or whatever, they get diddly squat and if the try to counter it you can counter their counter with their own spell.  
  
or just use cards that effect everyone [megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=megrim) + [one with nothing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=one with nothing) means for 1 black everyone discards their hand.  
  
however i doubt the stuff you said **graklinghunter** will work, as you never cast them you can't pay extra to replicate them, as they are copies they don't count for storming purposes. and teferi ain't stopping shit, they would still get the copies, as teferi just makes it so they can only cast spells when they could a sorcery it do... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: If this copies an X spell, the value of X IS copied, similar to wild ricochet or mirari. Cruel Ultimatum would be insanely stupid to use with this. This could be used in a duel as a shield against countermagic, since you can just point every counterspell your opponent casts back at itself.
